meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of Wuthering Waves:

Get ready for an open-world adventure that's sure to keep you hooked – or at least trying to convince your wallet to part with some cash. As a seasonal grok (that's a fancy way of saying I'm a gamer who likes to have fun), I dove headfirst into the world of Wuthering Waves, and here's what I found.

First off, the combat is solid – like, seriously solid. It's fast-paced, action-packed, and reminds me of those old-school RPGs where you could actually feel like a hero. The exploration aspect is also a major win, with plenty of nooks to poke around in and secrets to uncover. It's like the developers took all the good bits from games like Genshin Impact (more on that later) and blended them together into something unique.

But here's the thing – Wuthering Waves wants you to spend time in its world, and hopefully, some of that time will be spent tossing coins into the game's coffers. Now, I get it; free-to-play games need to make bank somehow. But when you're trying to hook me with a weak storyline (more on that later too), it gets old fast.

Some critics have praised Wuthering Waves for its combat and exploration, like Movies Games and Tech, who gave it a solid 70. And hey, if you're into that sorta thing, more power to ya. But I'm more of a story person myself – which is why I was disappointed (but not surprised) by the subpar voice acting and, well, let's just say "weak" storyline.

Now, don't get me wrong – it's not like Wuthering Waves is a complete bust. The devs are working on addressing those issues, so maybe by the time you read this, things will be looking up. And hey, even But Why Tho?, who gave it a 50, said it has some strong moments.

All in all, Wuthering Waves is like that one friend who's always trying to do too much – they want to be the cool kid on the block (Genshin Impact), but they're not quite there yet. Maybe with some more refinement and a solid identity of their own, Kuro Games will have a winner on their hands.

But for now? I'll just keep poking fun at myself while waiting for that patch.
